items.name: Antigua Guatemala
items.description: A charming colonial city surrounded by volcanoes
items.fullDescription: A charming colonial city surrounded by volcanoes, known for its cobblestone streets, colorful facades, and baroque architecture. A UNESCO World Heritage Site and cultural heart of Guatemala.

items.name: Lake Atitlán
items.description: A breathtaking lake surrounded by the volcanoes Atitlán
items.fullDescription: A breathtaking lake surrounded by the volcanoes Atitlán, Tolimán, and San Pedro. Visitors can explore nearby Mayan villages each with its own crafts and traditions.

items.name: Tikal National Park
items.description: One of the most important ancient Maya archaeological sites
items.fullDescription: One of the most important ancient Maya archaeological sites, hidden in the jungle, featuring towering temples and plazas in a rainforest setting.

items.name: Chichicastenango Market
items.description: A vibrant highland market famous for handcrafted textiles
items.fullDescription: A vibrant highland market famous for handcrafted textiles, wood carvings, and Mayan masks. Open on Thursdays and Sundays, it also includes the historic Santo Tomás Church.

items.name: Pacaya Volcano
items.location: Near San Vicente Pacaya, Escuintla Department, Guatemala
items.description: An active volcano offering accessible hikes
items.fullDescription: An active volcano offering accessible hikes, Adventurers can reach lava fields and roast marshmallows over natural volcanic heat vents while enjoying panoramic views.

items.name: Semuc Champey
items.location: Near Lanquín, Alta Verapaz Department, Guatemala
items.description: A hidden paradise with turquoise limestone pools surrounded by lush jungle
items.fullDescription: A hidden paradise with turquoise limestone pools surrounded by lush jungle, Great for swimming, relaxing, or exploring nearby caves.

items.name: Río Dulce & Livingston
items.description: A tropical river that leads to the Caribbean Sea
items.fullDescription: A tropical river that leads to the Caribbean Sea. Livingston is known for Garifuna culture, music, and Afro-Caribbean cuisine.

items.name: Traditional Guatemalan Cuisine
items.description: Guatemalan food reflects rich cultural heritage
items.fullDescription: Guatemalan food reflects rich cultural heritage, Dishes like pepián, kak’ik, and tamales blend Mayan and Spanish influences and offer a taste of local tradition.
